title: Facebook Launched Facebook Shops to Make It Easier to Sell Products On Its Platforms
text: Facebook is pushing into e-commerce in a big way, enabling small businesses to directly sell products from Facebook and Instagram.

title: What We Know About Facebook Shops
text: Social media giant Facebook, Inc. (NASDAQ: FB) introduced Facebook Shops on Tuesday, a platform meant to help companies sell their products on Facebook and Instagram.

title: Facebook unveils Facebook Shops for small businesses
text: Facebook Inc. introduced Tuesday Facebook Shops, which is intended to make it easy for small businesses to sell their products online, starting in the U.S.

title: Facebook to launch new shopping feature across apps
text: Facebook Inc  is launching Facebook Shops, a service that will allow small businesses to display and sell their products on the social network's platforms, Chief Executive Officer Mark Zuckerberg said on Tuesday.

title: Facebook and Instagram rolls out Shops, turning business profiles into storefronts
text: Starting today, you’ll be able to browse and buy products directly from a business’ Facebook Page or Instagram profile. Both Facebook and Instagram already supported a degree of ecommerce — for example, Facebook has its Marketplace and will likely make a bigger push through its Libra cryptocurrency initiative, while Instagram allows users to buy products […]

title: Facebook and Instagram are about to become small-business shopping hubs
text: Facebook is targeting small merchants with a new ‘Shops’ feature, letting them promote collections of goods within Facebook and Instagram.

title: Mark Zuckerberg announces Facebook Shops, making it easier for businesses to list products for sale
text: Facebook Shops, which is free, will let businesses set up product listings on their Facebook Page, Instagram profile, Stories or in ads, But in most cases, customers will still have to click through to the business site to complete the purchase.

title: Facebook, Instagram push further into e-commerce with launch of online shops
text: Online shopping is the new normal during the coronavirus pandemic.

title: The real reason Facebook bought Giphy for $400 million
text: Facebook may want to turn Giphy into the next phase of its advertising business. But that probably isn’t its main ambition for the internet’s favorite GIF search engine.
